articles.author: Andrei
articles.description:
I’ve been in the cryptocurrency space since early 2017 — but I’ve always had an interest in technology and finance so it was an incredible discovery for me when I first stumbled on this space. I’ve seen the world become increasingly more monopolised with a handful of organisations controlling most of the media, computing, and electronics, while […]
The post What I learned starting a cryptocurrency podcast appeared first on cryptomaton.
articles.title: What I learned starting a cryptocurrency podcast

articles.author: Andrei
articles.description:
I recently had a fascinating conversation with Christoph Jentzsch, a former core developer of Ethereum and author of The DAO. Christoph was there during the launch of Ethereum and the rise and fall of The DAO and it was amazing to hear him talk about it. I also learned a lot about the Ethereum lore […]
The post The early days of Ethereum according to former core developer Christoph appeared first on cryptomaton.
articles.title: The early days of Ethereum according to former core developer Christoph

articles.author: Andrei
articles.description:
Blockchain interconnectivity is going to be a big focus in the years to come, well beyond just EVM-compatibility. I recently had a fascinating discussion on this topic with Interchain Foundations’ Managing Director Maria Gomez and Product Lead for Inter-Blockchain connectivity protocol Susannah Evans. The Interchain Foundation have been instrumental in the building and development of […]
The post How Interchain are Building an Internet of Blockchains appeared first on cryptomaton.
articles.title: How Interchain are Building an Internet of Blockchains

articles.author: Andrei
articles.description:
I recently had a great conversation with Michael Sanders, one of the Co-founders at Horizon. He and his team have built an incredible platform that allows game developers to easily access and use blockchain data in game development. This is the kind of tool that’s going to power the next paradigm shift in modern gaming. […]
The post What’s on the Horizon for the Future of Web3 Gaming? appeared first on cryptomaton.
articles.title: What’s on the Horizon for the Future of Web3 Gaming?

articles.author: Ϗ
articles.description:
Frames excited enough users to make Farcaster worth their time. To be honest, I wouldnt say I liked Farcaster at first, as it required installing a native app on my phone. In 2024, when its called Web3; why would anyone install a native app?! 
At least the Warpcast app works in the browser after completing the registration process, so why not try it? Especially with all the hype around Frames. And when Im already on it, why not write a few words about it?
So, here it is, yet another Farcaster Frames explainer for you!
What are Farcaster Frames?
Technically, Frames are an extension of the Open Graph protocol (OGP) but a peculiar one, as you can use OGP features just as a fallback and not mix them.
In practice, you use the fc:frame or the og: metatags. This is a bit strange, as it doesnt all…
articles.title: Farcaster Frames Explained

articles.author: Victor Fawole
articles.description:
The rich get richer every day, even when it comes to grant programs; however, Vitalik Buterin, the co-founder of Ethereum, thinks that for Web3 to be truly democratic, grant fundraising should also be democratic.
That brought a new dawn, a new way of raising funds that prioritizes the voice and needs of the majority over the minority big-holder investor.
Quadratic funding (QF) is the new way of fundraising in Web3. The time of crowdfunding is over!
In this article, you will learn the aim behind QF and the potential opportunities embedded in it.
Sit back and enjoy reading!

History of Quadratic Funding

Unsplash: Joanna
We must first trace its origins to understand QF (a.k.a plural funding). Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin envisioned it in collaboration with Zo Hitzig and E. Glen Weyl f…
articles.title: What is Quadratic Funding, and How Does it Work?
